dataset.title: Atmospheric deposition and Chemistry of precipitation and snow from _ Bucegi - Piatra Craiului LTER_EU_RO_002

section.para: Air quality data represents concentrations of O3, NO2 and NH3 measured during the period 15.05-15.10 (monthly exposure) of years 2011 and 2012 in 11 plots in Bucegi-Piatra Craiului LTER site. Atmospheric depositions were measured during the whole period (2011-2012) in 6 plots. The reported parameters are: pH (determined by potentiometry), conductivity (conductimetry), nitrite in NH4 and inNH3 (water ion-chromatography) and alkalinity (titrimetric determination)

section.title: Dataset legal obligation reporting
section.para: Council Directive 92/43/EEC of 21 May 1992 on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora;1992-05-21;publication

para.literalLayout: Air quality data represents concentrations of O3, NO2 and NH3 measured during the period 15.05-15.10 (monthly exposure) of years 2011 and 2012 in 11 plots in Bucegi-Piatra Craiului LTER site. The pollutants were monitored using Ogawa passive samplers (www.ogawausa.com). Chemical analysis of passive samplers was performed at ICAS Campulung Moldovenesc laboratory, using ion-chromatography for ozone determination and colorimetry for NO2 and NH3.Atmospheric depositions were measured during the whole period (2011-2012) in 6 plots. Precipitations were collected inside the forest (throughfall) using 8 collectors and in open field using 2 collectors. Soil solution was monitored in 2 plots, using the profile method, with collectors placed at 10, 20, 40 and 60 cm depth (2 replicates). The reported parameters are: pH (determined by potentiometry), conductivity (conductimetry), nitrite in NH4 and inNH3 (water ion-chromatography) and alkalinity (titrimetric determination). All chemical analysis were performed by ICAS Campulung Moldovenesc laboratory following the methodology described in ICP Forests Manual (http://www.icp-forests.org/pdf/FINAL_Depo.pdf; http://www.icp-forests.org/pdf/FINAL_SoilSol.pdf)
